thread.title: A Travel Guide For TV Lovers
thread.title_full: A Travel Guide For TV Lovers

author: Joy D'Souza
title: A Travel Guide For TV Lovers
text:
reddit 
Not sure what to do for your next long weekend? Instead of sitting in front of the TV for three days straight, why not take a trip to the real life locations of your favourite series? 
If you're lucky enough to live in Vancouver, you're probably well aware of the dozens of shows that film in your area. From teen hits like Supernatural to classics like the X-Files , Hollywood North holds that nickname for a reason. 
But what if you want to get out of the country altogether? You could head down to Georgia where they film The Walking Dead and The Vampire Diaries or hop on a plane to Europe where many popular shows film episodes and sometimes full series. 
In the slideshow below, we list 20 cities TV lovers should add to their bucket lists. Of course, if wandering through multiple cities seems too tiring for you, you could also just head down to a few studios. The Warner Brothers lot in Burbank, California is home to the beloved Gilmore Girls and Friends sets. And not to worry east coasters, there's studios on your side too, like Kaufman Astoria Studios in Queens, New York, where Orange Is The New Black is taped. 
Of course there are thousands of sets we'd love to visit in our lifetimes, not to mention all the places The Simpsons have been able to travel to ! 
Which TV-inspired destinations do you want to visit? Let us know in the comments below and we might even add them to our list. Close A Travel Guide For TV Lovers of   Fans of Supernatural need not look further than Vancouver for a chance to spot hunters Sam and Dean. The hit CW series has filmed all over the city during the course of its 11 season run. Recognizable spots include the Vancouver International Airport where "Phantom Traveler" was filmed in season 1 and the Astoria Hotel where "Lazarus Rising" was filmed in season 5. Fun fact: before the Winchester brothers started hunting supernatural beings in this location, Mulder and Scully were scouring the same ground while shooting the X-Files. And the duo is back in town filming a six-part remake as we speak. Find more Supernatural filming locations on fan site Supernatural Locations. Vancouver is home to may popular TV series, check out this list by ET Canada to learn more. While you wait for Fuller House to premiere on Netflix like the rest of us, why not venture down to San Francisco to take a picture but the original Full House house? Located on 1709 Broderick Street near Alamo Square in San Francisco, these painted houses are part of the show's famous opening sequence. Who knows — you might even spot an old cast member nearby. Both John Stamos and Bob Saget have been known to visit the area. Filmed between Culver City and Marina Del Ray, Arrested Development locations are easy to spot in the area. From the airport to the university and even a few hotel lobbies, fans can stop to take pictures all over the city. Check out movie maps for location directions. The O.C might have called it Newport Beach, but California natives know the show was actually filmed at both Redondo Beach and Manhattan Beach. Visit seeing stars for directions to all of the OC's film locations. 90210 is the most famous zip code around, but did you know the original show wasn't even filmed there? "Beverly Hills High" is known as Torrence High and it's in the exact same city in which Buffy The Vampire Slayer was filmed. Also in Pasadena? The original location of Bev's famous hangout: the Peach Pit. When you're in California be sure to stop into West Hollywood for dinner at SUR. The chic restaurant and lounge is owned by Real Housewives of Beverly Hills star, Lisa Vanderpump and doubles as the main set for her spin-off series Vanderpump Rules. Breaking Bad wasn't just filmed in Albuquerque, it was set there too. Fans of the show need only drive along Central Avenue to spot familiar spots, including the car wash! But if you really want to see one of the show's main memories, drive to Los Alamos Avenue — Jesse's house which is currently up for sale there. Filmed between California and Louisana, True Blood's opening scenes include a number of Louisana hot spots. It's also the location of Bill Compton's family home in the show. Learn more about all the True Blood locations here. If you watch The Vampire Diaries, this tower might look awfully familiar. While Mystic Falls is said to be located in Virginia, the teen drama is actually based in Covington, Georgia. If you're in the area, be sure to drive out to Glenridge Hall in Sandy Springs, which is the on-screen home of the Salvatore brothers. Fun fact: this square was also used as "Hazzard Square" in the first five episodes of the Dukes of Hazzard. Visit Mystic Falls Tours to book a spot on the casts' recommended tour. Just a short drive away from Covington is whole bevy of Walking Dead film locations. From Brooks to Senoia to East Newnan to Haralson and Sharpsburg, AMC's zombie hit has the cast running from city to city. Be sure to visit the Farmhouse just outside Newborn or check out the prison off Route 16 near Senoia. You won't be disappointed! For a closer look at all the Walking Dead filming locations check out this super detailed Google Map. Mike and Harvey might think they're New York City lawyers, but fans of Suits know the show is actually filmed in Toronto. Filmed along the King and Bay corridor, locals are quick to spot familiar towers like the Scotiabank Plaza and restaurants like Mercatto. Oh, and if you're a fan of Orphan Black, you might want to swing by Union Station, which serves as the show's train station, or check out 32 Mariner Terrace, also known as Beth Child's condo. Yes, Monk's Diner exists... well kinda. The famous blue and red restaurant sign seen on episodes of Seinfeld belongs to Tom's Restaurant, a greek eatery located near Columbia University. Most actors dream about filming in the big city, but most end up on studio sets out west. Fortunately for the casts of Gossip Girl and Sex and the City, their dream was a reality. The teen drama filmed mainly on the Upper East Side, with cameos outside of Nightingale-Bamford School (which served as Constance Billard), and of course, those famous MET steps. Find more must-see GG sights here. For the Sex and the City lover, almost every corner of Manhattan has served as a background for this iconic show, but if there's once place we insist you visit, it would have to be Carrie's brownstone stoop located on 64 Perry Street. Check out Fodor's guide for even more Sex and the City destinations. Bean town has been featured in multiple movies and TV shows including Parks and Recreation, Empire, Shameless and of course Chicago Fire. Check out this map for a closer look at all the Chicago-based film locations. Go where everybody knows your name. The Cheer's bar really does exist in Boston, in fact there are two of them. But the one on Beacon St. is the want you'll want to visit. No, that's not Washington, D.C. but if you watch House of Cards you might think it is. The Netflix original films most scenes in Maryland. From Freddy's Rib Joint — which is actually just an abandoned building on Better Waverly — to Frank and Claire's season one and two home on Park Avenue in Bolton Hills. Get the scoop on all of the Underwood's film locations in Baltimore. HBO hit The Wire was also famously about Baltimore. Baltimore Sun reporter Justin Fenton visited some of those show's most famous spots for fans to see a side-by-side of the show and the streets. Check out the photos here. Dawson's Creek seemed awfully close to Boston, but in real life the show was mainly filmed in Wilmington, North Carolina. Get the addresses to some of the show's landmarks here. Yes, those breath taking landscapes on Game of Thrones are for real. This stunning tree lined avenue will have GOT fans reminiscing about season two when Ayra Stark made her escape from Kings landing. GOT also films in Malta, Croatia, Iceland and Morocco. Did someone say Eurotrip? Get a closer look at the real life locations on the Daily Mail. After years of filming in North Carolina, Homeland is moving to Capetown, South Africa which will serve as a fake Istanbul on the show. When the cast of Elementary moved to London for season two, fans of the show were taken on a trip right along with them. Though the show filmed in many spots throughout the city (including in front of Buckingham Palace), they seemed to draw the largest crowed in Trafalgar Square.  Share
